title: 107_hr1509
content: The Act is titled the "National Media Campaign to Prevent Underage Drinking Act of 2001." It amends the Public Health Service Act to include a program for a national media campaign to prevent underage drinking. The Act titled the "National Media Campaign to Prevent Underage Drinking Act of 2001" requires the Secretary to conduct a national media campaign to reduce and prevent underage drinking in the United States. The campaign is to be administered through the Office of Public Health and Science in consultation with the Surgeon General, and based on scientific evidence. The Secretary will implement the national media campaign in consultation with the Surgeon General, based on scientific research on youth attitudes and underage drinking prevalence in the United States. The Secretary will implement a national media campaign based on reputable academic and scientific research on youth attitudes and underage drinking prevalence in the United States, as well as on mass media prevention campaigns. The campaign will supplement existing efforts to reduce and prevent underage drinking and coordinate with other Federal agencies. The Secretary will supplement existing efforts to reduce underage drinking in the United States and coordinate with other Federal agencies and departments. The Secretary will work with various federal agencies to target prevention and treatment resources for consumers in specific geographic areas through a national media campaign. The Secretary will allocate funds for a national media campaign focusing on prevention and treatment resources for consumers in specific geographic areas, ensuring messages are culturally appropriate and reach minority groups. The campaign will prioritize advertising to meet its reach and frequency goals. The Secretary will allocate funds for a national media campaign focusing on prevention and treatment resources for consumers in specific geographic areas, ensuring culturally appropriate messages reach minority groups.
